newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli soldier wounded in Hizbollah shelling.
newsitem.headline: Israeli soldier wounded in Hizbollah shelling.

text.p: An Israeli soldier was wounded on Saturday when Hizbollah guerrillas fired mortar bombs into his outpost in south Lebanon, pro-Israeli militia sources said.
They said guerrillas fired mortar bombs into the outpost of Ghozlan in the eastern sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone. The injured soldier was taken immediately to Israel.

In Beirut, Hizbollah claimed responsibility for the attack and said its fighters also clashed with a group of Israeli soldiers in Kassarat al-Oroush and shelled the outposts of Sojoud, Rihan and Kfar Houna in the eastern sector of the zone.
Militia sources inside the zone confirmed the attacks saying no one was injured. They said a number of shells fell inside the inhabited town of Rihan, causing no casualties or damage.
Hizbollah guerrillas fight Israeli troops and their local militia allies in a bid to oust them from the 15-km (nine miles)-wide south Lebanon occupation zone.
